You can go here to download these suits. It requires Texture Replacer.

I've been messing around with custom astronaut suits for Kerbals and I'm debating whether or not to have a part of their suit indicating what their specific job for the mission is, being pilot, medic, biologist, geologist, etc. It would look like below.

I just wanted others' opinions on this idea. I really don't know how to do it on smaller manned missions where one kerbal has many jobs, though. This could've been in the Addons section but I thought it was more fitting here.

I like it, and much less confusing than before. Though I thought Red was command and Yellow engineering? (I know it was in TNG)

In the original series, gold was Command, blue was Sciences/Medical, and red was Operations, which included Engineering and Security. The reason redshirts got such a bad deal was that the Security department provided defense during landing parties, and took the brunt of enemy opposition. Also, there were no major characters in Security, so they could introduce a guy and kill him off easily.

If you use extraterestial launchpads you want kerbals with low stupidity as they produce more, very stupid kerbals might even reduce productivity.

However you get plenty of stupid ones and they work just as well for piloting and eva work so you want to separate them
One update might introduce more statistics for Kerbals - like the Final Frontier mod does for their duty roster - adding ranks, branches and such.

Yes, there is. In the Texture Replacer's folder (found in GameData) go to @DEFAULT.cfg and it will instruct you how to do such things.

I'll make a pack of it and release it when I'm done, and I will have a few different options of colored suits.
